titles.title: District of Columbia and United States Territories Circulating Quarter Dollar Program Act
District of Columbia and United States Territories Circulating Quarter Dollar Program Act

To provide for a circulating quarter dollar coin program to commemorate the District of Columbia, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, the United States Virgin Islands, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Domestic Monetary Policy, Technology and Economic Growth.
Mr. Castle moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4005.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.subcommittee: Domestic Monetary Policy, Technology, and Economic Growth
committee.name: House Financial Services

bill.summary: 10/7/2002--Passed House without amendment. District of Columbia and United States Territories Circulating Quarter Dollar Program Act - Amends Federal law to authorize the Secretary of the Treasury to mint and issue during 2009 redesigned quarter dollars commemorating the District of Columbia and the U.S. territories.
